DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04NPCFKatelynAlden: So, you're the new boss? Colter was no pushover. If you were tough enough to take him out, then you definitely earned that title.
RESPONSE TEXT: Whatever his faults, I'll say this - Colter built something here, something important.
A lot of people come a long way to trade here. A lot of caps flow through the market.
It's the kind of opportunity you don't want to take for granted.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Wouldn't be much of a market if we didn't have customers.
SCRIPT NOTES: A little condescending... "don't screw this up"

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Wouldn't be much of a market if we didn't have customers.
RESPONSE TEXT: Exactly. Customers means caps, and caps means everyone's happy. When a bunch of Raiders aren't happy any more, the bullets start flying.
DIALOGUE AFTER: KatelynAlden: There's one other thing you should probably know. I've got an arrangement with Shank.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'll run this place however I want.

SCRIPT NOTES: Cool, aloof, barely an apology / Neutral

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What do you mean?

DIALOGUE AFTER: KatelynAlden: There's one other thing you should probably know. I've got an arrangement with Shank.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Exactly. Customers means caps, and caps means everyone's happy. When a bunch of Raiders aren't happy any more, the bullets start flying.
